thread.title: Weight loss: 10 ways starving can backfire, harm your health

author: Moneycontrol
title: Weight loss: 10 ways starving can backfire, harm your health
text:
By Namita S Kalla | January 31, 2025
Image: Canva
When deprived of food, your body slows down essential functions, affecting immunity, digestion, and reproductive health
Image: Canva
Extreme calorie restriction forces your body into starvation mode, making it harder to burn calories and sustain weight loss
Image: Canva
Instead of just burning fat, your body breaks down muscle for energy, weakening your metabolism and strength
Image: Canva
Starving impacts your energy. Without proper fuel, youâ€™ll feel constantly tired, sluggish, and unable to focus on daily activities
Image: Canva
Starvation triggers hunger hormones, increasing the urge to binge on high-calorie, unhealthy foods
Image: Canva
Skipping meals can lead to bloating, constipation, and irregular bowel movements, disrupting gut health
Image: Canva
Hunger affects mental well-being and causes mood swings. It leads to irritability, anxiety, and difficulty in concentrating
Image: Canva
Staying hungry impacts your immunity. Lack of essential nutrients makes you more prone to infections and slows recovery from illnesses
Image: Canva
Starving deprives your body of vital vitamins and minerals, leading to anaemia, brittle bones, and poor skin health
Image: Canva
Extreme diets are unsustainable, often leading to rapid weight regain once normal eating resumes. Focus on balanced meals
